Combining music, mantra, meditation and a few dance moves from time to time, kirtan offers a rich, immersive experience that has the power to change the world, one heart at a time. Get your tickets now!\\\",\\\"geoCode\\\":{\\\"latitude\\\":51.4905467,\\\"longitude\\\":-0.2144088},\\\"price\\\":{\\\"currencyCode\\\":\\\"GBP\\\"},\\\"pictures\\\":[\\\"https:\\/\\/cdn.smartvel.com\\/ccpictures\\/taxonomy\\/people-dancing-against-orange-background.jpg\\\"],\\\"minimumDuration\\\":\\\"\\\"},{\\\"type\\\":\\\"activity\\\",\\\"id\\\":\\\"6441837\\\",\\\"self\\\":{\\\"href\\\":\\\"https:\\/\\/test.api.amadeus.com\\/v1\\/shopping\\/activities\\/6441837\\\",\\\"methods\\\":[\\\"GET\\\"]},\\\"name\\\":\\\"Tim Arnold\\\",\\\"geoCode\\\":{\\\"latitude\\\":51.52445,\\\"longitude\\\":-0.16929},\\\"price\\\":{\\\"currencyCode\\\":\\\"GBP\\\"},\\\"pictures\\\":[\\\"https:\\/\\/cdn.smartvel.com\\/ccpictures\\/taxonomy\\/img_concert_2.jpg\\\"],\\\"minimumDuration\\\":\\\"\\\"},{\\\"type\\\":\\\"activity\\\",\\\"id\\\":\\\"6441278\\\",\\\"self\\\":{\\\"href\\\":\\\"https:\\/\\/test.api.amadeus.com\\/v1\\/shopping\\/activities\\/6441278\\\",\\\"methods\\\":[\\\"GET\\\"]},\\\"name\\\":\\\"Double Bill: Il segreto di Susanna\\/Pagliacci\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Experience the enchanting ambiance of London's Opera Holland Park Theatre with a captivating concert that promises to deepen your appreciation for opera.\\\\n\\\\nA compelling double bill delves into themes of sexual jealousy, featuring Wolf\u2010Ferrari's sophisticated honeymoon comedy juxtaposed with Leoncavallo's gripping tale of betrayal and murder. The narrative unfolds as suspicions of infidelity lead to tragic consequences, revealing secrets that are not as they initially appear.\\\\n\\\\nRenowned artists Clare Presland, Richard Burkhard, and John Savournin reunite for the revival of John Wilkie's elegant 2019 production of Il segreto di Susanna. Notably, the esteemed tenor David Butt Philip makes his debut as Canio in Martin Lloyd\u2010Evans's new staging of Pagliacci, conducted by Francesco Cilluffo. Alison Langer shines as Nedda, Canio's disillusioned spouse, while Harry Thatcher portrays her ill\u2010fated lover, Silvio. Immerse yourself in the world of these timeless operatic masterpieces at this must\u2010see event.\\\",\\\"geoCode\\\":{\\\"latitude\\\":51.502433,\\\"longitude\\\":-0.202219},\\\"price\\\":{},\\\"pictures\\\":[\\\"https:\\/\\/cdn.smartvel.com\\/ccpictures\\/taxonomy\\/5848766054_0c9b7fd2e4_z.jpg\\\"],\\\"minimumDuration\\\":\\\"\\\"},{\\\"type\\\":\\\"activity\\\",\\\"id\\\":\\\"6441348\\\",\\\"self\\\":{\\\"href\\\":\\\"https:\\/\\/test.api.amadeus.com\\/v1\\/shopping\\/activities\\/6441348\\\",\\\"methods\\\":[\\\"GET\\\"]},\\\"name\\\":\\\"Yinka Shonibare CBE: \u2018Suspended States\u2019\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Britain is littered with symbols of death and exploitation; not hidden away shamefully, but raised up, celebrated and gloried. Public sculptures of controversial historical figures are everywhere, and now they\u2019re in the Serpentine too, because Yinka Shonibare CBE has put them there.\\\\r\\\\nThe Nigerian-British art megastar has filled the gallery with recreations of statues of Churchill, Kitchener, Queen Victoria and Clive of India. But they\u2019re scaled down, their power diminished, minimised, undermined. They\u2019re puny now, smaller than you, weak. And of course, they\u2019re covered in Shonibare\u2019s signature Dutch wax print (colourful fabric inspired by Indonesian printing traditions, traded by the Dutch, ubiquitous in Africa, and now used by Shonibare as visual shorthand for the complex history of colonialism).\\\\r\\\\nThis is what Yinka Shonibare CBE \u2013 that Commander of the British Empire title matters \u2013 does, what he\u2019s always done: highlight, tear apart and subvert the legacy of British imperialism with directness, colour and wit. The debate around public statues of figures like Churchill and Clive \u2013 whose accomplishments came at a terrible human cost, who caused so much pain to the people over whom they ruled \u2013 has been raging for years now, and it feels like the flames of its anger abated a while ago. But Shonibare\u2019s installation is a clever, almost joyful reappropriation of historical pain, injustice and trauma.\\\\r\\\\nIt makes for grim if colourful viewing\\\\r\\\\nShonibare has filled the central gallery with architectural models of places of sanctuary \u2013 the Amnesty International offices, Tokeiji Temple in Japan which protected women fleeing domestic violence, Peter Mott House in New Jersey which was part of the Underground Railroad \u2013 a darkly atmospheric, fragile paean to the need for safety in a dangerous world. In among them is a model of the Bibby Stockholm barge, used by the UK government to hold asylum seekers in cramped, dirty, unsafe conditions. Maybe not all places of refuge are what they seem.\\\\r\\\\nThe final work is a library of books about war from throughout history, all rebound in Dutch wax print. Shonibare is forcing us to ask who writes history, whose perspective is elevated above others, whose lives are worth more, what matters? It makes for grim if colourful viewing.\\\\r\\\\nThe works on canvas here are not his strong suit, and the timeline of his GAS artist residency program is a missed opportunity to amplify the artists he\u2019s done so well to support over the years. And though the rest of the show is good, you can\u2019t help feeling that it\u2019s the exact same idea he\u2019s been churning out for decades. There\u2019s nothing new here, but if you had an idea this good you\u2019d probably overdo it too.\\\",\\\"geoCode\\\":{\\\"latitude\\\":51.50479,\\\"longitude\\\":-0.174983},\\\"price\\\":{},\\\"pictures\\\":[\\\"https:\\/\\/cdn.smartvel.com\\/ccpictures\\/taxonomy\\/14123868744_9e627220dc_z.jpg\\\"],\\\"minimumDuration\\\":\\\"\\\"},{\\\"type\\\":\\\"activity\\\",\\\"id\\\":\\\"6441496\\\",\\\"self\\\":{\\\"href\\\":\\\"https:\\/\\/test.api.amadeus.com\\/v1\\/shopping\\/activities\\/6441496\\\",\\\"methods\\\":[\\\"GET\\\"]},\\\"name\\\":\\\"Neil Warnock Live\\\",\\\"geoCode\\\":{\\\"latitude\\\":51.503509999999984,\\\"longitude\\\":-0.22384000000000476},\\\"price\\\":{},\\\"pictures\\\":[\\\"https:\\/\\/cdn.smartvel.com\\/ccpictures\\/taxonomy\\/img_concert_14.jpg\\\"],\\\"minimumDuration\\\":\\\"\\\"},{\\\"type\\\":\\\"activity\\\",\\\"id\\\":\\\"6441553\\\",\\\"self\\\":{\\\"href\\\":\\\"https:\\/\\/test.api.amadeus.com\\/v1\\/shopping\\/activities\\/6441553\\\",\\\"methods\\\":[\\\"GET\\\"]},\\\"name\\\":\\\"Otobong Nkanga\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"For her inaugural exhibition with Lisson Gallery since joining last year, Otobong Nkanga returns to the process of drawing at both large and small scales, revisiting an area of foundational importance to her practice, which is rooted in the connections between thinking, performing and making. Drawing functions both as site of exploration and as cementation of her wider iconography as an artist, featuring bodies, landscapes and abstract passages, as well as the ecological and cosmological subject matters that spin out into the rest of the work. From this starting point, she reveals new sculptural objects, including stacked and striated columns of ceramic vessels (produced for a major solo show in Spain last year) as well as wall-hung and floor-based works that combine rope, glass, oils and tactile materials into personal, scented talismans.\\\",\\\"geoCode\\\":{\\\"latitude\\\":51.5211047,\\\"longitude\\\":-0.1681336},\\\"price\\\":{},\\\"pictures\\\":[\\\"https:\\/\\/cdn.smartvel.com\\/ccpictures\\/taxonomy\\/14143618843_d0d24523cb_z.jpg\\\"],\\\"minimumDuration\\\":\\\"\\\"}],\\\"meta\\\":{\\\"count\\\":110,\\\"links\\\":{\\\"self\\\":\\\"https:\\/\\/test.api.amadeus.com\\/v1\\/shopping\\/activities?longitude=-0.44161&radius=50&latitude=51.57285\\\"}}},\\\"attributes\\\":{\\\"headers\\\":{\\\"date\\\":\\\"Thu, 26 Dec 2024 13:25:15 GMT\\\",\\\"content-type\\\":\\\"application\\/vnd.amadeus+json\\\",\\\"transfer-encoding\\\":\\\"chunked\\\",\\\"connection\\\":\\\"keep-alive\\\",\\\"cache-control\\\":\\\"no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate\\\",\\\"expires\\\":\\\"0\\\",\\\"pragma\\\":\\\"no-cache\\\",\\\"referrer-policy\\\":\\\"no-referrer-when-downgrade\\\",\\\"strict-transport-security\\\":\\\"max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains\\\",\\\"vary\\\":\\\"Accept-Encoding\\\",\\\"x-content-type-options\\\":\\\"nosniff\\\",\\\"x-frame-options\\\":\\\"DENY\\\",\\\"x-xss-protection\\\":\\\"1; mode=block\\\",\\\"ama-gateway-request-id\\\":\\\"rrt-095584195de5afc6a-a-de-3641027-496554863-1\\\",\\\"access-control-allow-headers\\\":\\\"origin, x-requested-with, accept, Content-Type, Authorization\\\",\\\"access-control-max-age\\\":\\\"3628800\\\",\\\"access-control-allow-methods\\\":\\\"*\\\",\\\"server\\\":\\\"Amadeus\\\",\\\"access-control-allow-origin\\\":\\\"*\\\"},\\\"reasonPhrase\\\":\\\"OK\\\",\\\"statusCode\\\":200}}}"}
